resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

kszucs commented on pull request #6329: ARROW-5742: [CI][C++] Add nightly Valgrind build
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/6329#discussion_r374197527
 
 

 ##########
 File path: docker-compose.yml
 ##########
 @@ -85,13 +85,44 @@ services:
     environment:
       <<: *ccache
       ARROW_ENABLE_TIMING_TESTS:  # inherit
+      ARROW_USE_LD_GOLD: "ON"
     volumes: &conda-volumes
       - .:/arrow:delegated
       - ${ARCH}-conda-cache:/build:delegated
     command: &cpp-conda-command
       ["/arrow/ci/scripts/cpp_build.sh /arrow /build &&
         /arrow/ci/scripts/cpp_test.sh /arrow /build"]
 
+  conda-cpp-valgrind:
+    # Usage:
+    #   docker-compose build conda-cpp
+    #   docker-compose run --rm conda-cpp
 
 Review comment:
   `docker-compose run --rm conda-cpp-valgrind`

fields.description: A daily or weekly Valgrind build on the ursa-labs machines would further check sanity of the C++ code base, though with ASAN and UBSAN builds on Travis-CI we're already well covered.

comments.body:
If a {{docker-cpp-valgrind}} job is added to https://github.com/apache/arrow/blob/master/dev/tasks/tests.yml#L21 it will be automatically picked up by the nightly docker cron job on 

https://github.com/ursa-labs/crossbow/blob/trigger-nightly-builds/.travis.yml

The question remains how to notify the dev@ list when there is a failure
